item.title: Rebasing a patched Linux kernel on openEuler Copr (EUR)
WeeChat
item.description: See also WeeChat Config. Switch between buffers Press Alt+number to switch to the corresponding numbered buffer. To switch between server and WeeChat core buffers, press Ctrl+X.

item.title: pwru
item.description: Requirements pwru requires >= 5.3 kernel to run. For --output-skb >= 5.9 kernel is required. (Will auto-detect) For --backend=kprobe-multi >= 5.18 kernel is required.

item.title: Package Managers Map
item.description: For use in $HOME: github.com/conda-forge/miniforge, with the conda-forge channel set as the default (and only) channel. For deterministic and declarative configuration: Nix with nix-installer, and home-mangler for a lightweight package-only alternative to home-manager, or nix-darwin for declarative system-wide configuration on macOS.

item.title: top
item.description: Keys e / E, :Enforce-Task-Memory-Scale and :Enforce-Summary-Memory-Scale. Cycle through the available memory scaling which ranges from KiB through EiB.

item.title: Alloy Collector Configuration Example
item.description: node_exporter Based on the template at grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/monitor-infrastructure/integrations/integration-reference/integration-linux-node/ ...

item.title: Name Resolution on Linux
item.description: With glibc, name resolution goes getaddrinfo() â†’ nsswitch.conf (for Name Service Switch, which is not Network Security Services) â†’ /etc/hosts or DNS. If DNS: â†’ libresolv â†’ host.conf â†’ /etc/hosts or real DNS.

item.title: nsswitch.conf
item.description: nsswitch.conf, the Name Service Switch configuration file, is used by glibc and certain other applications. Most notably, it controls the user, group and host lookup processes.

item.title: macOS Disk Space Analysis
item.description: Analysis Analyze file tree size: sudo ncdu -x /System/Volumes/Data Monitor file access: sudo fs_usage -w | grep <keyword> Clean up sudo log erase --all # for /var/db/diagnostics ...
